title: Oil extends drop after report on Iran sanctions
text: Oil futures extended a decline after Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said the U.S. offered to remove all sanctions on the country in exchange for talks. Losses deepened after Reuters reported the remarks, but were then trimmed after Brian Hook, the U.S. special representative for Iran, was quoted as calling Iran's claims "baseless." Crude built on losses that were seen after The Wall Street Journal reported that Saudi Arabia had moved to impose a partial cease-fire in Yemen. West Texas Intermediate crude for November delivery CLX19, -0.62% on the New York Mercantile Exchange remained down $1.01, or 1.8%, at $55.40 a barrel, while November Brent crude BRNX19, -0.94% was off $1, or 1.6%, at $60.74 a barrel.
description: Oil futures extended a decline after Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said the U.S. offered to remove all sanctions on the country in exchange for talks....
